title: How to Make Kojo Cake from Palembang

steps.headline: Put the eggs, flour, and sugar into the basin.
Stir the ingredients until the mixture blends completely.
Pour the coconut milk when the mixture is already well blended.
Add green paste or food coloring to the mixture.
Stir the mixture.
steps.description: When the mixture has blended well, pour the mixture into the baking pan smoothly.

steps.headline: Turn on the oven.
steps.description: Set the temperature of the oven to 100˚C (low heat). Put the mixture of kojo cake in the baking pan to the oven. Bake it for 30 minutes

steps.headline: Remove from the oven.
steps.description: Serve–the kojo cake is now ready. Cut into small pieces and arrange on a serving plate. Enjoy!

text: Put the eggs, flour, and sugar into the basin.  Stir the ingredients until the mixture blends completely.  Pour the coconut milk when the mixture is already well blended.  Stir the mixture again.  Add salt to the mixture.  Add green paste or food coloring to the mixture.  Stir the mixture. When the mixture has blended well, pour the mixture into the baking pan smoothly. Turn on the oven. Set the temperature of the oven to 100˚C (low heat). Put the mixture of kojo cake in the baking pan to the oven. Bake it for 30 minutes Remove from the oven. Serve–the kojo cake is now ready. Cut into small pieces and arrange on a serving plate. Enjoy!
